value: Cows and Horsemen Cross a Bridge Over a Canal

label: Description
value: A horseman drives two cows and some sheep over a bridge spanning a small canal. Farm houses in left middle distance, and a town on the far side of a large body of water, left distance.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum
Large Trees on a Road; Sheep Crossing a Stream

label: Description
value: A clump of large trees borders a road, right. In the left distance a herdsman drives sheep across a shallow stream.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum
Large Trees on Rocks by a Shallow Stream

label: Description
value: Large trees stand on rocks bordering a shallow stream, left, beyong which is a village. A man with a mule approaches at the right.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum
Four Actors in a Town Landscape

label: Description
value: Two men and two women encounter on the street of a town. Other buildings across a river in the background. One of a series of theaterical subjects showing a Ukiyoye scene.

label: Physical description
value: Colored woodcut in black and yellow ink on grey-brown paper

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957; Acquired by Museum
Large Trees on Rocks by a Shallow Stream

label: Description
value: Large trees stand on rocks bordering a shallow stream, right, beyond which is a village. A man with a mule approaches at the left.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum
A Large Tree at the Edge of a Swamp

label: Description
value: A large tree, at left, bends over a swamp which extends over the entire foreground. Woods and an open landscape, right distance.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum
Two Figures Approaching a Low Foot-Bridge

label: Description
value: Near the edge of a forest, two figures approach a wooden foot-bridge, behind which is a pale fence.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum
Two Rustics Seated on a Bank Near Three Trees

label: Description
value: Near a clump of three large trees two peasants sit on a bank in conversation. The roof of a cottage, right and other cottages are seen through trees, left distance.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum
Cottage Near Mud Flats, With Distant Village In the Evening

label: Description
value: A cottage stands in the left foregound, with a ruined building at the right, overlooking mud flats and a distant village with windmills, as seen in the evening light.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum
Thatched Cottage by a Swamp in the Evening Light

label: Description
value: A thatched cottage stands behind a large tree, left, on the edge of a swamp; a church spire in right distance, seen in the evening light.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum
A Village in a Broad Landscape in the Evening Light

label: Description
value: A village in a broad landscape is seen in the light of evening, while two others appear in the background.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: A cottage with two figures conversing at the door stands at left. Near by, a man with a pack on his back converses with a seated woman. A pool is in the right center foreground.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum
Man Resting on a Grassy Bank Under a Large Tree

label: Description
value: A man rests against a high grassy bank by a large tree. A village with a church spire is seen through trees in the center distance. Plate reworded. Verso: Sketches of leaves (in pencil).

label: Physical description
value: Etching on paper, verso: graphite on paper

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum
Portrait of Robert Bertie, 1st Earl of Lindsey

label: Description
value: In an oval stone enframement, surrounded by instruments of warfare, is a bust length portrait of Robert Bertie, First Earl of Lindsey (1572-1642).

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Buno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum
Head of a Young Man in Left Profile

label: Description
value: The head of a young man is seen in left profile. He wears a large flat hat with a feather, and appears to be in armor with a heavy drapery over his shoulders.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957; Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Neptine and sea nymphs and monsters are seen sporting over the waves; a closely knit composition.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: In an oval enframement is the bust portrait of Pierre Jeannin (1540-1623). He faces slightly to the right; wears a full beard, and heavy overcoat. Engraving made to illustrate the work, Les négociations de Monsieur le President Jeannin, published in paris in 1656.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum
Portrait of Philibert-Emmanuel de Beaumanoir de Lavardin

label: Description
value: Inscribed in an oval is the bust portrait of Philibert-Emmanuel de Beaumanoir de Lavardin, Bishop of Mans (1617-1671), seen wearing the order of the Saint-Esprit. Below, his coat of arms in an oval frame.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum
Portrait of Louis XIV, King of France

label: Description
value: In an oval enframement is a bust length portrait of Louis XIV, King of France (1638-1715). The sitter faces hald right and wears an ermine cape and order of the Saint-Esprit.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: In an oval enframement is a bust portrait of Cardinal Mazarin (1602-1661). He is shown facing half right; he wears one tassel under his collar, and a satin cape.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: In an oval enframement is the bust portrait of François de Nesmond, Bishop of Bayeux (1629-1715), shown in clerical attire, wearing a simple episcopal cross suspended on a ribbon. Below, his coat of arms in an oval enframement. At the four corners, hunting horns.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: In an oval enframement the bust of Pierre Séguier (1588-1672) is shown facing slightly right. He wears the order of the Saint-Esprit. Below center, the sitter's coat of arms in an oval enframement.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: In an oval enframement is the bust portrait of Jean Chapelain (1584-1674), shown wearing two tassels about his neck and a heavy cloack.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Farm buildings, some in ruins, in a broad landscape. A tower surmounted by a weathervane, left middle distance. Farm cart and fire, left foreground.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Farm buildings, some in ruins; same scene as in 1957-41-78, but from opposite direction. A tower, with chimney, left center. Bird house, left foreground.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum
Christ at the House of the Pharisee

label: Description
value: Christ is seen seated at table with six other figures. At His feet, the Magdeline is putting oil on them. Numerous other figures in the scene.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957; Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: In an oval enframement is the bust portrait of Abraham de Fabert, Marshal of France (1599-1660). He is shown facing half left, wearing armor and with a sash over his left shoulder, under a lace collar. The sitter's coat of arms in an oval frame.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum
Fountain of the Animals at Versailles

label: Description
value: A single spout fountain in a square basin fed by pairs of animals stands in a hedged-in area bordered by clipped trees. Figures in the foreground.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum
View of the Fountains at Brunoy

label: Description
value: A series of parterres approached by steps. In the center a cascade is flanked by fountains. Clipped trees along borders. Figures in the foreground.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: In a mountainous wooded landscape, with classical buildings in the background are seated the Virgin with the Child on her lap, who reaches for a fig held aloft by the Mother. At the left, Joseph is seated against a bank reading.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Horsemen and dogs pursue a wolf through a forest. In the left foreground are two horsemen.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: In an oval enframement is the half length portrait of the Swiss legendary figure, Wilhelm Tell (probably around 1400-1450), turned slightly to the left, his cross-bow in his hand.

label: Physical description
value: Colored engraving, possibly aquatint on paper

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum
Portrait of Louis Michel Le peletier de Saint-Fargeau

label: Description
value: In an oval enframement is the bust portrait of the Revolutionary figure, Louis Michel Le peletier de Saint-Fargeau (1760-1793), turned slightly to the right.

label: Physical description
value: Colored engraving, possibly aquatint on paper

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Three female figures seated on clouds are shown making music; that on the left composes; the center one plays a lyre, and the one on the right is playing a kind of voila de gamba.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Two heavily robed standing figures, turned slightly to the left.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: A young barefooted girl is seated in a simple domestic interior, in the act of feeding a child seated on a low box besides her. Another child plays with an apple on the floor.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: A young barefooted girl serves cream in mugs to two children from a covered wicker tray on a low pedestal. An open door, left.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: A young barefooted girl is seen in a simple domestic interior, seated, instructing two standing children who peer at an open book, resting against her knee. A cat lies in the foreground.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: A barefooted peasant girl stands in a landscape, with a child on her back and another stands beside her, clutching at her garments. She holds a basket of greens in her arms.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: A barefooted young girl, a shepherdess, stands in flock of sheep spinning. In her right hand she holds a distaff, and in her left, a spindle. Beside her sits a small boy near a tree.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum
